pros: UNCDF is expanding more into using financial instruments, which has always been part of its mandate but never fully capitalized on. This makes it an exciting place to work, with lots of changes , innovation, and opportunities.
cons: Lots of great colleagues, but many are very focused on their own specific area, and there is a lack of collaboration across the organization. For such a small organization, there is a surprisingly high level of in-fighting and distrust among colleagues.

review_title: Impactful agency but poor working conditions for interns
pros: Interns and consultants are quickly given plenty of responsibility and are able to learn from multiple aspects of the programme.  UNCDF is a small agency operating across many countries, so there is opportunity to gain exposure to different markets and regions.
cons:
Procurement for consultants is a nightmare. Every contract renewal is a lengthy process with no guarantee of success. 
Interns are unpaid and usually have little prospect of achieving paid employment within UNCDF.
Micromanagement from senior staff damages productivity and efficiency

pros: Very knowledgeable supervisor and co-workers. All interns have very prestigious academic background. Provided a lot of training and hard-core work.
cons: Stressful and competitive environment.  Being unpaid.

review_title: Good place to work - but limited growth opportunities

cons: Slow contracting, limited space to grow.
